data.title: East Bay pets of the week for July 19
meta_keywords: Friends of the Alameda Animal Shelter
data.meta_description: Area shelters’ dogs and cats need their "forever" homes.
data.text:
Hello there, I’m Phyllis! I’m a lovely older gal with a gentle spirit and a smile that radiates sunshine! I’m perfect for a mellow home, where I’ll happily sit by your side as we enjoy each other’s company. I came from a big dog family and need a patient friend to help me build confidence and celebrate every little victory. I’m sweet and ready to be your adoring buddy, eager to explore the world beyond my old yard. An extra doggie friend would be icing on the cake! Visit the website of the Berkeley-East Bay Humane Society at berkeleyhumane.org to learn more and schedule a meeting with me.

— Berkeley Humane

Feisty 1-year-old Chili is a social butterfly. She loves to play with toys of all kinds, announcing her enthusiasm with a precious squeak. Chili isn’t afraid to show her affection and loves making new friends to climb onto for a quick nap. Come meet this gregarious gal at our Dublin Adoption Center! The East Bay SPCA offers walk-in adoptions at its Oakland and Dublin campuses from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Wednesday through Sunday. For updated and real-time information on programs and offerings, visit eastbayspca.org/adoptions.

— East Bay SPCA

Lima came to Friends of the Alameda Animal Shelter after being found outside a grocery store, tied to a pole with an electric cord. Despite her sad abandonment, she’s an incredibly affectionate, loving, sweet, smart pup. This gorgeous 5-month-old Husky has everything going for her. Lima gets along with other dogs, learns quickly and loves to interact with anyone who wants to pet her. To meet this pet at FAAS, call 510-337-8565 or visit alamedaanimalshelter.org/adopt.

— FAAS

Johnny Bench and Sparky are our boys of summer. Hall of Famers — or “the best kittens we have ever had” — according to their foster mom. Johnny of the big hands is a polydactyl. Sparky will never compare another kitten to Johnny. Contact Angela at takeakittenhome@gmail.com. Community Concern for Cats now holds weekend adoption events at Pet Food Express stores in Walnut Creek and Martinez along with our regular location at 1250-H Newell Ave. in Walnut Creek. Visit communityconcernforcats.org for more information.

— CC4C

Opal’s stunning white coat and soulful eyes will win your heart over. She’s active but has a sweet and calm nature — and is very family friendly. Opal is house-trained, leashed-trained and ready to show off her good recall skills. She’s also good off leash and good with other dogs. Plus, Opal is very smart and will pick up any new training easily. Contact the staff at Milo Point Richmond for assistance from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. except Tuesdays at 220 S. Garrard Blvd. in Richmond. Our dedicated staff is on duty every day caring for our animals and have saved more than 39,000 lives in 28 years. For more details, visit milofoundation.org/contact-us.

— Milo Foundation
